intro: Pentaphragma acuminatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster. It is an important plant for pollinators and has some traditional uses in herbal medicine.
